description:
Clicked install but nothing happened so going to the Flatpak website to download.

Why the 5 stars then? The problem is with the software centre, or my connection, not the software.

I used this program (app) earlier this year while trying out PopOS on one of my computers. It was awesome, as simple as Balena Etcher, but with the added bonus of checking the checksum, and therefore the integrity of your original download, which can be a confusing exercise for a beginner. Brilliant.

The sort of thing one would expect from the folks at System 76. I already own a Galago Pro Galp3, my main workhorse which just keeps on going.

Linux rocks, and the developers worth their weight.

Thanks heaps, Jacob Westerhoff
Used on Ubuntu 20.10, works as it should, highly recommended
This app is great,i used the flatpak version,as simple as balenaEtcher but with checksum checking,which i cant do manualy.Thanks System76!
its virus stop install

First off, Balena Etcher used to be my go to app for flashing USB drives. However it seems on both Linux and Windows, while it starts out great. I stops working after a while. This has never been an issue with Popsicle! While Popsicle is not as fast at flashing images as Etcher is, it has become my new default. Great work Popsicle team!
summary: Slower than Etcher, but a lot more reliable

description: Nothing to complain

It's so good. When I was on a search of easy to use flashing apps on Linux I found this perfect app. I use it to flash Debian, Arch, and many other distros. The biggest con is that it can't flash windows images, but who uses windows anyway??? 10/10
summary: Not gonna lie, my favourite app

description: Works well. Would be nice if it could format the device as well.
Downloaded, tried to write windows ISO to usb - WARNING Windows ISOs are not supported. Uninstall. Looked nice though.

best one out there 
very small gui
very easy to use
The best thing ever. Better then the other apps that are bloated
i want to install windows 7 on my machine.
summary: Can this be used with a Windows 7 iso?

description: I have tried in different distros and so far didn't failed me in any of them.

Simple app that does the job and does it well.

It includes a field to check the ISO image with provided hashes.
summary: Good app and it works well

description:
Great app! I use it frequently to test new Linux distros booted via USB stick. It's by far the easiest app I've ever used for this task and it never fails. 

However ... at the moment, when I update Flatpak (I'm using Popsicle as a Flatpak app), I get an error message about Popsicle not using the latest org.freedesktop.Platform* runtimes. 

The app still works, but it apparently needs to be updated to work with the 2022 runtimes, rather than the 2020 ones. I'm not sure whether this is an issue for System 76 (the Popsicle people) or Fedora (my distro) or someone else. In any case, as I said, everything still works. This is just an annoyance.
summary: Easist ISO burner to use, but currently (10/22) needs updating?

description: 64gb Steam Deck with this app was no hassle

WORKS perfectly to image to USB Drives, NON MicroSD. Don't imaging to 
mSd that are conected to reader cards seems like it fails. Flashed a 
STEAMOS recovery IMAGE no problemO!
summary: Dont forget to extract your image from the compressed format
